title: Peanut-Chocolate Balls
description: Rich, chocolatey, and deeply satisfying — a homemade treat with simple ingredients.
instructions: Dry roast peanuts until aromatic. Cool completely. Crush coarsely. Keep 1 to 2 tbsp aside.
Paste the dates. Add Oats, Cocoa powder, Oil, Salt & vanilla. Mix until a thick, sticky dough forms. Add the crushed peanuts.
Take 1 level tablespoon mixture per ball. Roll into smooth balls. Refrigerate for 15–20 minutes.
Heat water in a pan until hot (not boiling). Place chocolate in a heat‑safe bowl over the pan. Add oil and stir gently until smooth and glossy. Add reserved peanuts.
Dip chilled balls into melted chocolate. Place on a plate or parchment. Refrigerate 15 minutes until set.

title: Microwave Potato Chips
description: Crispy, thin potato chips made effortlessly in the microwave with minimal oil.

Seasoning: Kashmiri red chilli powder – to taste

instructions: Scrub the potatoes thoroughly under running water to remove all dirt. Do not peel them; the skin adds texture and flavor.
Using a mandolin slicer, cut the potatoes into very thin, even slices to ensure uniform cooking.
Place the slices in a bowl of water and rinse 2–3 times until the water runs mostly clear. This removes excess starch and helps achieve crisp chips.
Drain the slices well and pat them completely dry using a clean kitchen towel. Any moisture left behind can cause uneven cooking or burning.
Transfer the dry slices to a bowl, add the neutral oil, and gently toss so each slice is lightly coated.
Lightly grease a microwave-safe plate or line it with parchment paper.
Arrange the potato slices in a single, non-overlapping layer. Avoid stacking to ensure even cooking.

Microwave on high power for 5–8 minutes, checking every 2 minutes. Rotate the plate and flip or rearrange slices as needed. Stop cooking as soon as the chips turn lightly golden and crisp — overcooking can cause burning, especially in the center.
Remove from the microwave and let the chips rest for 1–2 minutes. They will continue to crisp as they cool.
While still warm, transfer the chips to a container, add the seasoning, close the lid, and shake gently until evenly coated.
tips: Microwave power and slice thickness vary. Always cook in short intervals and monitor closely in the final minutes for a clean, evenly cooked result.
